intro.title: Middle Path Practice
intro.text: Some things we must accept as they are, while others we can work to change. This exercise helps you identify which is which and create actionable steps for both.

steps.title: Describe the Challenging Situation
steps.prompt: Write about a challenging situation you're currently facing. What's making this difficult for you?
steps.placeholder: Describe the situation that's causing you stress or difficulty...

steps.title: What Parts Need Acceptance?
steps.prompt: What aspects of this situation are outside your control and need to be accepted as they are?
steps.placeholder: List the parts you cannot change and must accept...

steps.title: What Parts Can You Change?
steps.prompt: What aspects of this situation are within your control and could potentially be changed?
steps.placeholder: List the parts you have some control over and could work to change...

steps.title: Actionable Steps for Acceptance
steps.prompt: What specific actions can you take to practice accepting the unchangeable parts?
steps.placeholder: Example: Practice mindfulness when I notice resistance, remind myself 'this is how it is right now'...

steps.title: Actionable Steps for Change
steps.prompt: What specific, concrete actions can you take to work on changing what's within your control?
steps.placeholder: Example: Have a conversation with my manager about workload, set boundaries with my time...

steps.title: Reflection
steps.prompt: How does it feel to separate what you can accept from what you can change? What insights emerged?
steps.placeholder: Reflect on this process and any insights you gained...
